Subject: Re: [junit] Help,what's wrong with my TDD practice in my daily life?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=182451331; y=Ypr-OcdQtn2uZhkUv8o5q44ao58oLGRED0Ntmjw9Cp0U76py

Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

> Fair enough, but I think it's equally dangerous to tell a novice
> "always do this" or "always do that".  In doubt, just ask, and the
> original poster did just that.

If you want to learn TDD, it actually is quite sound advice to always do 
TDD. And TDD, after all, *is* about mini steps. In fact I would argue 
that when learning TDD, you should take smaller steps than an 
experienced developer would take, just to get a feeling for how small 
they *can* be, and what it really feels like.

When you've experienced that for a while, you are in a quite good 
position to decide for yourself.

> Not having a lot of experience in an area also means you're not quite
> sure who to listen to, so at the end of the day, you sometimes do have
> to listen to your instinct...

When I'm new to something, I typically *don't* give a lot of attention 
to my instincts - because I know that they might very well be dead 
wrong. What I give attention to is to what people say that are good at 
what I'm trying to learn.

Cheers, Ilja
